text.p: - A new law on the state frontier which introduces a fee for crossing the Russian border has provoked a conflict between the Kremlin and the government.
- The Russian government has decided to significantly cut down the list of the banks authorised to deal with budget issues. This is a most dramatic event for the country's banking community.
- Moscow traffic police has reinforced road checks, especially on diplomatic cars.
- Russia's defence minister says private capital should be more active in financing the army.
- President Yeltsin is on top of the list of the 100 most influential polititians in Russia published by the paper.
- Alexander Lebed's transformation from an army general into a diplomat surprised many in Germany during his visit there. But some experts say Lebed has no constructive programme to rule Russia.
- All that the reformers have managed to achieve in Russia is to turn economy upside down and create a parasitic financial capital, the communist paper says.
- Russian federal authorities are preparing public opinion for a decision not to recognise presidential elections in Chechnya due to take place on January 27.
